review: The Fire TV Stick was purchased in order to access Amazon Prime content, which can't be done via the Chromecast. I'm a heavy Netflix and Hulu user and found the performance for those two apps to be worse on on the Fire TV Stick. There has been a lot more buffering and video quality/compression issues on the Fire TV Stick, and my internet speed tests are way above the minimum requirements for both products. So, the Fire TV Stick gets used exclusively for Amazon Prime access and nothing else.The remote included with the Fire TV Stick is a difference in user experience between the Chromecast, but I didn't find it to be any better or worse than the native app experience for operating a Chromecast on my iPhone. You get used to either.
author: sos8weall

review: While all of Amazon's services stream flawlessly, third party apps don't fare so well.  Netflix is particularly problematic.  I have consistent connection speeds above 20MBPS and yet the Netflix app does weird things like stalling the video while the audio continues.  I also dislike the fact that I can't side load any Google services.  While the price is right for this device, I'm thinking the right choice is a hardware vendor who isn't pushing their own services.

review: We would have really enjoyed it had it worked...either one actually as we tried two. The Fire TV stick kept dropping our internet connection. When it would finally play something it lasted for about 20 seconds and buffered for 10 of those seconds. We have no issues with any other wireless peripherals connecting and holding the connection. Overall a big disappointment.
